avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a strong wind from westerly directions, extensive wind slabs formed in all aspects. The large surface-area wind slabs of yesterday are covered with new snow and therefore barely recognisable. Even single persons can release avalanches in some places. Such avalanche prone locations are to be found in all aspects above approximately 2000 m. In very isolated cases they can be triggered in the weakly bonded old snow and reach large size. Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for caution and restraint.
Loose snow avalanches are possible, even medium-sized ones.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Medium-sized and large avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of new snow and strong wind.

snowpackStructure.comment:
40 to 70 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days. The sometimes strong wind has transported some snow.
Fresh snow and large quantities of wind-drifted snow of the last few days are bonding only slowly with the old snowpack.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2400 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions thus far only a little snow is lying.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

tendency.highlights: The avalanche danger will decrease gradually.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh snow of the last four days as well as the wind slabs are lying on top of a weakly bonded old snowpack. They represent the main danger. Even single winter sport participants can release avalanches. These avalanche prone locations are to be found in all aspects above approximately 2000 m. Additionally in some places avalanches can be released in deep layers and reach large size in isolated cases. Whumpfing sounds serve as an alarm indicating the danger.
Backcountry touring and other off-piste activities call for extensive experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.

Dry snow slides and avalanches are possible, but they will be mostly small.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant in some cases.

snowpackStructure.comment:
30 to 50 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days. The strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
At low and intermediate altitudes less snow than usual is lying.

avalancheActivity.comment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind from westerly directions, wind slabs formed. They represent the main danger.
Wind slabs can in some places be released by people. This applies especially at transitions from a shallow to a deep snowpack, especially in pass areas in gullies and bowls, and behind abrupt changes in the terrain, especially on steep slopes.
Restraint should be exercised because avalanches can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Be careful, many rocks hidden by fresh snow. The fresh wind slabs are small and in some cases prone to triggering.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

snowpackStructure.comment:
20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell in the last four days. The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. Adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas and at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions a little snow is lying.
In all aspects snow depths vary greatly above approximately 2200 m, depending on the infuence of the wind. On steep sunny slopes below approximately 2600 m a little snow is lying. At low and intermediate altitudes from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack in all aspects.
